messages.messageBody:
--- In Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com, Cararmst@a... wrote:
> In a message dated 9/7/2000 12:04:42 AM Central Daylight Time,
> lurine@s... writes:
>
> > We have deer also. In fact, the kidlets managed to get pictures
of
> > triplets not to long ago. The place where the Cadillac and
Lincoln
> > commercials was shot is down the road a piece and that's where
they saw the
> > triplets. We've also had them in our front yard.
> >
> > Lynda
> >
>
>
> Ahhhhhh! We live in a condo in a very urban area -- Dallas. I
have to get
> in the car and drive a 1/2 hour every once in a while just to see
some
> expanse of green -- although with the drought we don't even have
much of that
> around here anymore. I would dearly love to live a more rural
area, but my
> husband is a city boy and he's always needed to live in the city
for his
> work. Then again, he just found out yesterday that his company is
being sold
> and that in a few months he'll be looking for a new job. Maybe
now's my
> chance.
>
> Carron

Carron
I was brought up in a small country village in UK. I loved it. I
always felt that my own kids missed out living in the suburbs. If I
had my choice I would be back living on a farm at the drop of a hat -
or even a country cottage - hubby could commute to work each day.....
11yr old daughter hates the idea!! She doesn't know what she is
missing.
Marianne

messages.subject: country/city living
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 9/7/2000 12:04:42 AM Central Daylight Time, ... Ahhhhhh!  We live in a condo in a very urban area -- Dallas.  I have to get in the car and
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 9/7/2000 12:04:42 AM Central Daylight Time,
lurine@... writes:

> We have deer also. In fact, the kidlets managed to get pictures of
> triplets not to long ago. The place where the Cadillac and Lincoln
> commercials was shot is down the road a piece and that's where they saw the
> triplets. We've also had them in our front yard.
>
> Lynda
>


Ahhhhhh! We live in a condo in a very urban area -- Dallas. I have to get
in the car and drive a 1/2 hour every once in a while just to see some
expanse of green -- although with the drought we don't even have much of that
around here anymore. I would dearly love to live a more rural area, but my
husband is a city boy and he's always needed to live in the city for his
work. Then again, he just found out yesterday that his company is being sold
and that in a few months he'll be looking for a new job. Maybe now's my
chance.

Carron
